website_summaries.verdict: A basic drain pan with a nice funnel that will help you get the job done at a reasonable price.
pros: Spout makes it easy to stick the oil back in containers for recycling
A sturdy inexpensive option if you want to change your oil at home
cons: When emptying this model, you must be careful with the spout side of the drain to not empty too quickly and spill

customer_reviews.title: How can you not love a pan that holds oil
customer_reviews.text: How can you not love a pan that holds oil? It also holds tears and your hopes of being a rugged manly dude, when you realize changing your oil seems simple to everyone but yourself. I mean, come on, how hard is it now to not spill oil when putting it in? Apparently, really frickin' hard. I've got steady hands from being a photographer, but I don't have brain surgeon style shakeless hands. At least the pan is big enough to just pull the bottom plug and not miss. Just buy it if you need a good pan. You won't have any regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Corey W - The Storytelling Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: this is by far the most sturdy pan I've used
customer_reviews.text: What's really to say about this? Basically a plastic bucket with the spout. I've used many different kinds of oil catch pans with lids caps etc. That being said, this is by far the most sturdy pan I've used. Also the easiest to pour the oil into another container from. I order the 5 quart containers of oil on Amazon and the spout on this pan is very easy to stick inside those and put my used oil back in that container for recycling. You do need to stuff a rag in the spot when you're done, or else you will do it drips from it
customer_reviews.author: JHF 2.0

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity oil drain pan
customer_reviews.text: Somehow the newer vehicles that I have keep getting larger and larger oil capacities, and my old drain pan just wasn't big enough. This drain pan works well, having plenty of capacity to tackle all of my vehicle oil changes. The pouring spout is nice, but needs a bigger lip above it, so when you're tipping the drain pan to use the spout to pour into a disposal container, the oil doesn't run over the edge, and drop down the side of the pan. That was rather annoying.
customer_reviews.author: James Evans

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It has a wide diameter for catching large area of oil. The handles seem strong. The drain spout is really useful. It allows me to drain straight into my oil waste container without using a funnel.
customer_reviews.author: Jared K.

customer_reviews.title: Part of my mess free setup
customer_reviews.text: This drain pan is solid and easy to use as others have said, but you also need a good container for collection and transfer. I bought a Baytec 5 gallon steel bucket and installed Banjo fittings and caps in the two threaded holes. The drain pan spout fits directly into the large hole. The small hole allows air to flow so oil goes in and out without chugging and splashing. No more mess! Baytec Bucket:
customer_reviews.author: XMFJ4338

customer_reviews.title: This thing is huge. I'm an idiot.
customer_reviews.text: This is a HUGE drain pan. I should have bought the smaller one but I'm an idiot. Nevertheless, I'm keeping it as you never know when it will come in handy. Seems well made and has no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Dorkydavid

customer_reviews.title: It makes the pan useless. I would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: It says it hold 4.5 gallons and it does but when you have more than 3 gallons in the pan it is almost impossible to use the spout without oil pouring over the top of the pan instead of pouring out the spout. It makes the pan useless. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: ... for his oil which as you can imagine is pretty messy. This is nice and big and drains ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas as he's been using an old paint holder for his oil which as you can imagine is pretty messy. This is nice and big and drains very nicely out of the spout. Just an fyi, they shipped mine just like that without a box. I'm honestly kind of surprised it made it in such great shape so I can't really complain but it would've been nicer in a box or something.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really glad I found this product. My last oil container was extremely hard to keep clean, and leaked oil everywhere. With this, I'm able to drain the oil into separate containers (to recycle), and then clean it out for storage. I also like that the nozzle doesn't drip oil after using it. My last one would continuously drip oil for whatever reason.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Burly and useful
customer_reviews.text: Burly pan that won’t bend or distort even when full of liquid. The pouring spout makes life very easy, but does complicate cleaning the pan somewhat. I do like the fact that the pan is well-reinforced but the reinforcement ribs are somewhat annoying to clean on the interior of the pan, especially the bottom. But this pan is BIG and can be used for pretty much any fluid service on most vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Holds enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't measure it's capacity as it seems others have done but this pan meets my needs. It holds plenty enough for me. It's sturdy and well made of thick plastic. It's the same design I have used for many years. Great for all kinds of work. I use it for cooling system flush and fills. It hangs on a nail easily when not in use. I hope this was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: P. Theo

customer_reviews.title: So easy and clean
customer_reviews.text: I can not seem to ever pour the used oil into the recycle container with out making a mess. I've tried different pans in the past, never fails. Finally bought this one prior to changing my wife's oil, and so simple, easy and clean. It's nice and large to catch the oil from the car. So glad I got one. Now the old catch pan can be used to hold the funnel and used rags instead.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for at-home oil changes.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic item for doing your own oil changes at home. Sides are tall enough to prevent sloshing and spills. Short enough to require minimal raising of the vehicle, or none if it's a vehicle with high ground clearance (such as a truck). The nozzle makes it easier to empty the pan only where you want. Stiff enough that it won't bend and spill oil when you try to move it. Yes, it costs more than a barebones plastic pan, but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Superb -- larger size and handle/funnel are just amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb oil drain pan. First of all -- the larger size is just a must. Between the oil stream "shifting" 4-5" and then some from starting to finishing, and the oil filter on most cars (except Subaru's where it's on top ;)) dripping all over the place underneath, you absolutely will appreciate this. The next benefit is the elegant design between the "lip" that captures the oil when you try to drain it, and the handle which acts as a spout. Great job on the design. It's large, but it absolutely makes an oil change a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: VP

customer_reviews.title: Messy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product but I prefer the closed top drain pan. Once you use this, you need to be extra careful where you place this. If this pan flips or anything falls inside, it will get covered in oil.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: Much less mess with this pan
customer_reviews.text: This drain pan is AWESOME! I should have bought one of these years ago. I love that it's wide and has the drain spout setup the way it does. When you drain into a jug, the spout makes it very easy to avoid spillage. If you do your own vehicle's fluid changes I think one of these is a must, just get one and have a much easier life. I used this to change my automatic transmission fluid, just a pan drop type of change, and this thing contained all the mess effortlessly. Love it love it love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice big pan with a good lip to keep the oil in. A real must have if you change your own oil, especially a diesel. My truck holds 15 qts and this works great. Sturdy handles make it easy to pour the oil back into the gallon jugs for easy transport. Don’t cheap out, I guarantee you’ll regret it as the oil overflows or spills out of a less expensive pan when you go to pour. This thing has no flex and is a home-run...
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Seems overpriced at first glance, but works great
customer_reviews.text: I remember paying about 20, maybe 25 for this and thinking that sounded a bit steep for a big plastic bowl. However, it works great and I recommend it, even for that price. The capacity is a must for our larger vehicles that hold ~7 quarts of oil. I was right up to the brim on our old oil pan. This pan has a nice rolled over edge and a pour spout that actually works. I've used this guy a couple times now and haven't had any oil splashing out of the pan -- a big problem with previous oil pans from Wally World.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for oil changes
customer_reviews.text: Hard to imagine a drain pan working any better for DIY oil changes. Collected oil well with plenty of capacity, rugged, easy to pour entire contents into a waste bucket with a pretty small mouth. My only surprise (and this is truly not the fault of the drain pan) was that if you move the pan too fast when it has oil in it, it will splash upward easily. The handle on the side of this pan is super easy to use and effective.... but move your pan SLOWLY, don't shove or pull it to a new position, or you'll be splashing oil. Again NOT any fault of the pan, just inexperience on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Scobie P.

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: The Best! Absolutely puts other oil pans to shame. I don't need an oil pan that holds extreme amounts of oil. I literally wanted it for drainage of oil or other fluids, and then I can drain said fluids back into the container, all without making a mess or allowing drips along the floor. Also, it is wide enough that it can allow drainage from the oil pan and any drips from the oil filter location. Definitely recommend for DIYers.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic drain pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic oil pan. really. I use it often. Had several other designs and I like this open style with the pour off spout tucked into the top lip handle of bowl. Far better design then other pans. Holds a lot of oil. I could change 2 cars with 7 qts each and still have room for more fluid. I Love this thing, very happy with it. Durable plastic tub. Favorite part about, with it so wide open, hot Oil doesn't splash up and spatter as it flows thru the small drain hole on other drain tubs.
customer_reviews.author: KeanuReid

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a great pan
customer_reviews.text: Changed the oil on my XC60 for the first time using my old oil pan. The oil was about a half inch from the lip once done draining. Realized it was time for a new pan. While I haven't used this one yet I'm looking forward to it. The pan is solid and is more than deep enough to hold the almost two gallons of oil in the Volvo. Given my old pan was good for twenty plus years of oil changes I expect this one to be just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: This is a great drain pan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old smaller pan, because I got tired of removing the drain plug only to find the pan wasn't quite lined up with the drain and getting oil on my garage floor. This pan is huge and since using it, not a single drip on the floor. I also really like the pouring spout. I use it with a funnel to empty the old oil into a jug. My old pan didn't have this and again, resulted in an oily mess. With this one, not a spilled drop. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gta04

customer_reviews.title: This is the one.
customer_reviews.text: I have been changing oil for almost 40 years and have used nearly all of the collection pans on the market, aside from the ones with obvious flaws. I will never use another. This pan catches over 8 qts of oil from my truck and transfers it to a container with nary a drop lost. The rolled edges ensure the oil doesn't slosh over the edges and the spout fits right in to the 5qt oil bottles I use to store waste oil. It's pretty sturdy, so I'm hoping that it's the last one I'm going to ever buy. I will also get a green one for antifreeze.
customer_reviews.author: Crispy

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life? It’s perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been changing my own oil since I was a teenager. Recently I purchased a diesel truck that requires 10 quarts of oil. On a YouTube to change the oil, a link to this was placed. I gave it a shot and it’s been awesome. It catches the oil, it can handle large amounts, easy to grip and has a convenient drainage with no issues of spilling or causing a mess. It’s definitely worth the money. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Navarro

customer_reviews.title: No more spill for engine oil change job!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a simple pan type oil catcher. With just a small extruded lip on the rim, it is almost impossible to pour oil into a transport jug. This product solved that problem. It is also sturdy and holds a lot of oil. Well i did not give more star for Value for money as I found almost identical product in a local auto part shop at about half the price. But I do not regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: HimmelBlau

customer_reviews.title: Only holds 3 gallons
customer_reviews.text: This only holds 3+ gallons. If you have the pour spout pointing up hill a little you might get 3.5 gallons in it. Because of this I spilled a gallon of used motor oil on my driveway. I was thinking of testing it first but then it slipped my mind and I tried to use it on Diesel Truck that holds 4 gallons of oil.
customer_reviews.author: Hap

customer_reviews.title: Excellente!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is awesome!! I should’ve gotten this from the very beginning, instead of buying a cheap one from dollar store (so much spillage during transferring of oil.) You live and learn. This pan is big, sturdy, and great for transferring liquid to another container, I had zero spillage. Would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Osmin Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Best pan for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: My previous drain pain was so flimsy that it made me spill oil every time I was pouring it into the bottle. This pan is the opposite, it is great and even more for the price. I can now pour the used oil without help due to it's stiffness and handles. Build quality is so great that it seems like it will last for ever, so only reason I'll be buying more is as presents.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar M.

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: The lip around the edge is what makes this a great product. No more oil slopping over the side when you pull it back out from under vehicle...also the spout is angled perfect to drain old oil back into oil jug without the need for funnel .
customer_reviews.author: Capt. K

customer_reviews.title: Better for me than those special storage containers
customer_reviews.text: I used to use the oil collection/storage tanks, and I would always ended up with at least a bit of a mess. Those tanks always leaked. This drain pan is great because the oil doesn't spill anywhere but into the pan. I then easily poured it into a separate plastic jug to take to the recycle center. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wallin

customer_reviews.title: Sucks the life out of my truck
customer_reviews.text: But it’s okay, then I put nice fresh new life in. Synthetic life. 5-W30 life. And the old gunky stuff flows right into the pan smooth as silk. All 8 quarts of it. Then pours cleanly out of the nozzle into the jugs for recycling. What more could you possibly ask? It does it’s job. It does it well and does it neatly. It’s heavy enough for what it is. It’s easy to clean. Damn near perfect. Highly recommend. Thanks for reading
customer_reviews.author: MooseTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Didn't spill a drop
customer_reviews.text: For the first time in YEARS of changing oil, I didn't spill a drop when I used this a couple of days ago to change 2 vehicles' oil. It's tall enough to where the 'splash zone' is non-existent. All of the oil was caught and held within the lip of the oil pan. The only CON is that I wish it would have come with a cap for the drain neck for when you're done pouring the used oil into a different container. Overall, wonderfully satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: needed something large to catch the oil from my truck, and this did the trick. not flimsy at all. wouldn't flex if you put bricks in it. spout works as it should, just a bit of a pain to clean under the upper "lip" but who really gives a hoot about that. I would buy one with a top next time, but if you aren't using this as storage, and you have a place to put the used oil, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: This is the oil pan you want
customer_reviews.text: This thing is big. It’s large enough to collect oil from the filter drop and the drain plug at the same time on my vehicle. It is a heavy duty made oil pan. This isn’t flimsy, and it isn’t going to fall apart. Easily pour old oil back into bottles for recycling.
customer_reviews.author: Edward F. Winters

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan
customer_reviews.text: Great pan. It does exactly what it needs to do. I much prefer this design over the drain-reservoir design which holds all the oil on the inside. Reason being with this design you can actually clean the pan and can easily see if something else is there that is not supposed to be. The plastic feels sturdy and I trust that it will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well designed, the best choice
customer_reviews.text: After using a few other oil pans from big box retailers and auto parts shops, I was tired of the flimsy and poor designs that didn’t drain well or leaked making a huge mess. Read the other reviews. This one is extremely sturdy and well designed by people that actually tested and used the product. Pick this pan if you’re changing your own oil. This is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MD Rider

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I thought.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have quart markings inside the pan to see how much fluid has been drained as other cheaper pans found at walmart have, and for the price this one cost I was expecting at least to have markings, so I'm a bit disappointed by that, but it seems sturdy, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Absolute unit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome design. Makes changing oil so much less stressful! For easy cleanup, line with a heavy duty trash bag (or two), tie it off when you're done, and bring that sack of oil to your local recycling location. Cut a drain hole in your trash bag(s) of oil, drain appropriately, and dispose. No messy cleanup of your oil pan required.
customer_reviews.author: Preston D.

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and easy to pour
customer_reviews.text: this is a great drain pan. I was tempted to buy one of the types that seals so that you can dump the oil without having to drain it into another container, but after using one, I absolutely hated the quality. I think I could run this thing over and it would bend my wheel. It is pretty light and holds a ton of oil which is exactly what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: my new favorite drain pan
customer_reviews.text: I've been doing my own vehicle maintenance now for more than 30 years and this is the best fluid drain pan I've ever owned. It's large and simple design - the pour spout seems better designed to prevent spills when transferring to your recycle container.
customer_reviews.author: WJ Handy Dad

customer_reviews.title: Must have for DIY
customer_reviews.text: Used this for the first time today. Nice, large opening so you don't have to be perfectly alligned with your oil drain plug to avoid spills. It also pours directly into the five quart oil jugs without the use of a funnel! Nice, thick plastic, so I'm pretty sure it will last a long time under normal use. If you change your own oil, this pan is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Jason M

customer_reviews.title: Big enough but not as sturdy as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I do not honestly understand so many praises for this oil pan. The reviews are what made me buy it. The build quality is fine and it is a large size pan with a spout but nothing special about it. I'm not sure if I would consider it value for money. At half the price it would be a really good product.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Get this Drain Pan!
customer_reviews.text: Best oil drain pan for personal use I've ever used. Very sturdy, great placement handles for pouring the used oils into your just emptied fluid containers, and the lip ensures you won't spill a drop. I just changed the oil in my 5.9L Cummins, and filled three empty gallon jugs without any evidence I was ever there!
customer_reviews.author: David Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet, but it appears to be high quality. It’s definitely a good value. The size is great for those who have vehicles that use a lot of oil. Mine car takes 8 quarts, which is less than half of this pan's capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Justin J. Rebbert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with it. Its pretty strong and well constructed, I drained my transmission fluid about a gallon and half a quart and held up pretty good. I like the design of it, it makes it easy to check the oil and see how it comes out the car/truck. Makes it easy to pour into container and also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pan but tall for a motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: Got the job done. Very sturdy pan, and easy to transfer old oil to containers without much mess. I did need to get my rear wheel on a block to make enough space to slide this under my bike. May want to go with something a bit more shallow for that use case.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah R. Perry

customer_reviews.title: A really good oil pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy oil pan. I do not know if it is the best out there but for my needs (oil change) it was perfect. There is nothing I can complain about: it is sturdy, high capacity (held about 6-6.5 qt of oil), and I could pour the oil into a gallon milk jug without a funnel! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AGN Gazer

customer_reviews.title: great size
customer_reviews.text: I'd been looking for something that was low profile and would hold 11 quarts that can run out rather quickly. This is it. The handle and spout make it easy to pour into jugs to take to recycling. My new favorite drain pan.
customer_reviews.author: Roger G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great value! I’ve used this for my Jeep Grand Cherokee as well as a Nissan Rogue. This has fit all the oil in for these vehicles with no issues. Easy to use, clean, and store. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's large enough to catch the oil stream. You'll want to do something about splatter, though. This has a lip that directs the oil out the spout when you dump it. And it's easy to grasp. Working great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great design for an oil pan
customer_reviews.text: This makes it soooo easy to dump the used oil back into the empty oil jug. It has handles in all the right place, and enough capacity to eliminate all worries of sloshing when changing oil in a typical passenger car.
customer_reviews.author: W. Strong

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Why did I ever use the smaller ones? My Tundra holds almost 8 qts, and I needed a bigger pan as my old pan holds exactly 8 qts. Not only do I not have to worry about spilling, the pouring into the container afterwards is so much easier. Great design - thanks!
customer_reviews.author: GolfNut

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better spout
customer_reviews.text: This does just what it’s supposed to, good size for catching drainage grom drain pan and filter. Square shape of spout could be improved: I wish it were rounded and small enough to drain into a gallon jug without needing a funnel (which is awkward given the size which requires two hands to lift when full.
customer_reviews.author: Scrooobious Pip

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: This drain pan is a very simple and functional design. It holds enough oil to drain my diesel truck (12 quarts) and the handle and spout make transferring into my recycle tank easy and less messy than other drain pans that I have used.
customer_reviews.author: beezer

customer_reviews.title: should be cheaper
customer_reviews.text: This should really be about $5 cheaper. I think I paid about $17. It is well built and has a good size/capacity. The nicer thing about this compared to the ones that have a top to them with a drain hole is that with those types the oil hits the top near the top of the pan so there is more splashing since there are not high sidewalls like this has.
customer_reviews.author: livingaboard

customer_reviews.title: this is it good pan
customer_reviews.text: I tried the flimsy pan from a big retailer omg what a mess. this pan is made right and you won't spill oil all over the place. in this case, you do get what you pay for. Just wash the pan and use next time should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Bossman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, large capacity oil change pan.
customer_reviews.text: Huge pan. You can change oil and transmission fluids at the same time. Easy to empty spout. Double wall so it won't melt it burn your hands moving it. A tad in the pricy side, but will last a while longer.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyRocket

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheap one that felt very flimsy and hard to pour the used oil into a recycling bottle. This one is like night and day, sturdy, wide and very easy to pour in bottles. I’m very glad I got this. ^_^
customer_reviews.author: ICe

customer_reviews.title: It Works...Just pour slowly
customer_reviews.text: This oil drain pan fit my needs well. One thing to mention is when you begin to pour oil, pour slowly or else the oil will overflow the the drain pan spout. The funnel on the inside of the spout is a bit narrow for fast pouring.
customer_reviews.author: engineeron

customer_reviews.title: Nice drain pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan is huge, and it holds a lot of liquid. Works great for changing oil in a truck or draining antifreeze. The spigot really helps to prevent a mess when transferring the liquid from the pan to another container. The pan is pretty sturdy and will hold up well over time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very effective for a do-it-yourself oil change of yard power tools. I used it recently with a lawn mower and with an emergency generator. The size and shape is convenient to get under the equipment and catch the vast majority of fluids. Easy to empty into a container with a cap.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wayne

customer_reviews.title: It did what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new drain pan that would easily hold 7 quarts of oil and had a big opening. This did the job. BTW, don't try to fill it to its 4-1/2 gallon stated capacity (just go to half of that) and it will be easy to drain.
customer_reviews.author: Picker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drain pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan works is sturdy and performs well to drain all your oils. It has a lip around the top edge to reduce spills due to sloshing and the spout makes for easy transfer of your old oil into a container. It is worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! No spill!
customer_reviews.text: The pan is large and easily caught the stream from the oil pan as I removed the drain plug. Easily, no spills...same thing with the filter removal. The handles make it easy to move/shift/lift and the pour spout fit right into the top of my empty 5qt oil container (turned the old oil in to Auto*one)
customer_reviews.author: Richard Farr

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Moves easily, sturdy, large enough to remove drain plug and filter at the same time. Holds a good amount of oil. Easy to fill bottles with convenient spout. Great all around.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It's great! (Full disclosure, this was written by the wife)
customer_reviews.text: My husband swears by this thing. he says it is easy to use and easy to clean. I've personally not used it, but he seems to think it's the best drain pan thingy he's ever used. As long as there isn't a mess in my garage/driveway, I'm happy too.
customer_reviews.author: Buying.all.the.things.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This has made my life much easier. Draining oil back into containers was always the worst part about fluid changes. Now its VERY easy to drain fluids back into a container with the spout on this pan. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Spaid

customer_reviews.title: Not true to the size stated.
customer_reviews.text: Says it is a 20 quart container but at 13 quarts the fluid, oil in my case, spills out of the drain spout since there is no cap. Had two quarts of oil on my driveway. There's no way it holds 18 quarts.
customer_reviews.author: Rick32

customer_reviews.title: Now this is a drain pan.
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheapie and was sloshing oil all over the driveway. My car takes 4.5 and my GF's takes 5. This thing is cavernous. Sturdy and easy to use. Not a worry about spilling. Wish i had bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: You drain oil into it and it holds it.... yippee
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it 5 stars across the board if it would have had a little wider baffle at the end you pour out of so oil isn't as likely to spill over the edge if you want to pour faster. Otherwise it is a great product
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the garage
customer_reviews.text: Closest spill free oil change I’ve ever done! (Hard to mitigate drizzle/spray from drain plug removal) This oil pan is the perfect size to catch even the wildest oil stream.. and to top it off, the built in spout fits perfectly in the opening of a 5qt oil jug, so getting that spent oil into a disposable jug is easy easy easy!
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and High Capacity
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste time with flimsy drain pans. This one is rugged and easily handles 5+ quarts of used motor oil. The only trick is finding a place to store it as it takes up a bit more space than I was used to.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Stanwick

customer_reviews.title: Love this versatile pan!!*******
customer_reviews.text: This is really nice for changing mower oil ..push mower can tip over without spilling all over driveway.. Zero turn rider it worked great as well.. love the no spill rim.. and great for pouring into an old milk or jar/ bottle for disposals.. I'm a female and I highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Laura L. Darveaux

customer_reviews.title: ATD Drain Pan 4 1/2 gal.
customer_reviews.text: Received this but have not tried it out yet. Seems very well built, nice handles, large capacity and should do the job easily. In addition, it is a great buy and shipping was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: If you change your own oil frequently, you'll need this. The spout is perfect and it fits into a 5-quart oil container. I just pour the used oil into the same 5-quart oil container and take it to Walmart for recycling. No mess.
customer_reviews.author: Anlau

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Used this oil pan today and I’ve got to say it really is great! No spills when transferring the used oil to a container. Love the spout on it. Also it has a ring around the edge to help keep the oil in the pan and not dripping or pouring over the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: No mess, no fuss
customer_reviews.text: Chunked the small flimsy catch pan on the last move and ordered this one. Very well constructed and sturdy. Love the handles on both ends and easy pour spout. The larger/wider pan also was a huge plus. Clean up was also a breeze. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MRLaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for its single purpose
customer_reviews.text: Got this to start changing my oil, and yup. It holds oil. Appreciate the rollover edges to keep oil in even when sloshing around. The spout is small enough to drain it into any gallon container I have. All in all, it works as well as I could have hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle in PNW

customer_reviews.title: Great pour spout
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is easily positioned to catch all the oil. I specifically like the pour spout. The lip has an inner edge/channel that keeps the oil from spilling while pouring. I easily fill the empty oil containers for recycling at the local auto parts store.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle McDonald

customer_reviews.title: It'll catch it, and hold it.
customer_reviews.text: Great pan, did rear differential, transmission, and radiator flush with it at separate times. A tad tall for a lowered vehicle. But no drip or leaks unless operator error.
customer_reviews.author: RII

customer_reviews.title: Cheap oil change solution
customer_reviews.text: It's a good pan. stiff, fairly good quality, easy to transfer used oil... enables me to save a bundle... and oddly, my 6.0l diesel sounds quieter using Wally's finest.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Richards

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pour out old oil no mess
customer_reviews.text: It's a good size oil drain pan. It's really nice once the oil is drained out of your car it's very easy to pour the old oil into a 5-quart oil container with no mess. Got a handle on it easy to slide around. Definitely easy to use lightweight plastic hangs up in the garage perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: B.m

customer_reviews.title: it holds the oil
customer_reviews.text: I got a truck and used a drain into a device capture pan and it unfortunately was too slow and it ended up spilling all over the driveway. This solves that issue and now can be drained into the empty containers then recycled.
customer_reviews.author: 1101 base2

customer_reviews.title: No Brainer
customer_reviews.text: I got this pan for changing oil in my Kawasaki Teryx. This pan is durable an not cheap flimsy material. I love the spot and handles that make it so easy to pour the old used oil into a containers for recycling. This is a great pan!!!
customer_reviews.author: RKGuy63Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: ... the past and this by far has been my favorite. this kept all oil from hitting the ground ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had several oil pans in the past and this by far has been my favorite. this kept all oil from hitting the ground and is sturdy enough to hold all the oil I need it to, my only complaint is that it is big and bulky and it was a challenge to find a clean place to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Wigglebutt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for large oil quantity!
customer_reviews.text: 15 quarts of diesel crankcase oil filled this drain-pan to three quarters. There are several well-placed handles that allow you to carry and also to pour easily into containers! Very pleased with the product and glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.author: Cool-Riffs

customer_reviews.title: Great oil pan.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, love that built in spout, no need for a funnel, it holds plenty of oil and deep enough so that initial spurt of oil doesn't splatter on the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Quality DIY OIL Changer Tool
customer_reviews.text: Quality DIY Oil Changer Tool. Sturdy and thick. Does not flex when transferring waste oil into containers. If you have used skimpy pans, you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: A handy way to catch any fluids and dump them into another container. I've used it primarily for oil changes on motorcycles. One thing to note is the height of this drain pan. It fit perfectly under my first 2 bikes but doesn't quite fit under my 3rd. Not an issue with the product though.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Swickard

customer_reviews.title: Catches all the oil; holds all the oil; pours all the oil.
customer_reviews.text: My tractor has two oil drain plugs; this is big enough to catch them both easily, and hold the oil. Quality is fine for what it is, and the pour spout really helps reduce the mess.
customer_reviews.author: Old Navy

customer_reviews.title: Works like you would expect it to!
customer_reviews.text: Great plastic pan. Kinda hard to get excited about it! Wooo Hoooo!
customer_reviews.author: Good lookin' Ken!

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I doubt I will ever have to buy another pan, this one is quite sturdy and will work on the smallest of cars to the large trucks. Perfect tool!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you would want
customer_reviews.text: The drain pan is the perfect piece for easily collecting and disposing of fluids with literally no mess. I was very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: john stern

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This oil catch pan is much larger than I anticipated, but that doesn't mean it's a bad thing. It does it's job by catching used oil and it makes pouring the oil back in the containers much easier and can be done alone. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: DRU

customer_reviews.title: Not 4 1/2 gal closer to 3 1/2
customer_reviews.text: I changed a Ford f 350 diesel and it holds 13 quarts or 3 gal plus 1 qt I don’t see this could hold anymore than That Definitely not 4 1/2 gal Other wise a good pan
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Be nice to add a top
customer_reviews.text: This is big and serves its simple purpose..... to catch fluids It would be a good addition to add a top to the pan so the fluid can be transported in the pan
customer_reviews.author: Brightonuk

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and more than big enough for standard car oil change without splatter. Definitely stuff a paper towel in the spout after emptying to prevent drips, but that's typical with any drain pan.
customer_reviews.author: Bke13

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I looks a lot bigger than what the picture leads you to believe. It holds a lot of oil as I do my own oil changes. I like the handles on the side and the pour spout so you can easily pour old oil in containers. I highly recommend this for the DIY guy or gal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for DIY
customer_reviews.text: Nice and deep for extra large oil changes. Much sturdier than I expected. Splash lip keeps oil off of you and your driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Dave E
